intro: Erythranthe patula, commonly known as the "Rocky Mountain beardtongue," is a perennial flowering plant native to the western United States. It is characterized by its hairy stems and clusters of pink to purple flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. The plant thrives in rocky or gravelly soils and is often found in alpine or subalpine regions. It has narrow, lance-shaped leaves and is adapted to full sun and well-drained conditions. Erythranthe patula is valued in gardens for its ornamental appeal and ability to attract pollinators like bees and butterflies.
